talk.utter:
and if getting to federation is the only priority, then why triple the size of the beta userbase in the past month? why would they  keep expanding the size of the social media platform if they don't want to run a social media platform

is it just acceptable collateral damage?

talk.author: did:plc:idu7w6nxusiezlrlk62f4bbd
talk.utter: It's possible that they'd made knee-jerk moves to let more users onto the platform in order to provide them a safe space to propagate at the cost of moderation/community resources being spread thin. From that point, I get it, but it still comes at that cost.

talk.author: did:plc:wli3qpfcun2bcidet7uzjb44
talk.utter: right, the rapid expansion seemed like a well-meaning move to let in more queer and trans users due to changes on twitter. but there were already scant moderation resources -- a mod team without decision making power, user created mute lists. in that light it's not a responsible decision
